title: Chinese Remainder Theorem
statement: Given N pairs of (remainder, modulo) where all moduli are pairwise coprime, find the smallest non-negative integer X such that X â‰¡ r_i (mod m_i) for all i.
input_format:
First line contains N.
Next N lines each have remainder r_i and modulo m_i.
output_format: Print the smallest X, or -1 if no solution exists.
constraints:
1 <= N <= 100
1 <= r_i < m_i <= 10^9
Product of all m_i fits in 64-bit integer
